channel.title: Help me build a $500 Gaming PC
channel.description:
Well currently im selling a couple of my things that I don't need anymore because school is just taking too much time and I don't have time to use them so I figure I should spend the money on something I use all the time a computer. Well I always wanted to play games in my room but since ive always had a laptop in there it has never happened.
So this Is want I need. CPU: Needs to be a dual-core Intel only (Sorry but im also using this for a hackintosh so I can't use AMD) GPU: 119.99 BFG Tech 9800GTX - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814143149&cm_re=9800GTX-_-14-143-149-_-Product (Sorry also has to be this im building a hackintosh this card works ATI doesn't) RAM: 4GB is good any trusted brand is good HARDDRIVE: 47.99 320GB Western Digital http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136098 (Was cheaper than other brands) MOTHERBOARD:Any good one but it needs a PCI-E X16 2.0 Slot CASE: It needs to be HTCP one because fits under my desk http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811144231 was thinking this one but not sure about PSU tell me your opinions PSU: See above make suggestions
What you get to work with: 332.00 (That excludes the case I picked out) Getting under the price is also appreciated too thanks. Tell me if I missed key components (I Probably did)

item.title: Help me build a $500 Gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:19, topic:304521”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=400794.msg3021756#msg3021756 date=1257636212]

I could have sworn I added.

Well since you need a intel core duo, you’ll need to skip out on the casing. Or increase your budget to $550

Or just get a case that comes with a power supply from the same price.
[/quote]
Don’t think that there are cases with 550w + [I think 500’s the minimum for a 9800gtx?][/quote]That’s just bullshit from the gfx card manufacturers. I didn’t need more than 400w to run 2x radeon 4850 512mb in xfire.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me build a $500 Gaming PC

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:15, topic:304521”]Setup for your price range:

GPU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814143149&cm_re=9800_GTX--14-143-149--Product - $119.00

PSU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817709016&cm_re=PSU--17-709-016--Product - $59.99

MOBO: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813138142 - $44.99

RAM: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231158&cm_re=Ram_memory--20-231-158--Product - X2 $100.00

Case: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811119068&cm_re=Case--11-119-068--Product - $49.99

HDD: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136098 - $47.99

Total price - $421.96
Total price + shipping - ~$450.00[/quote]
no cpu?

item.title: Help me build a $500 Gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:10, topic:304521”]how can you not use AMD for hackintoshes?

all it needs is x86 and SSE3 support iirc[/quote]
You can, but it’s a lot harder since people have to hack up the drivers for the cpu and motherboards, rather than having most supplied already.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me build a $500 Gaming PC
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

GTS250 or GTX275 are the nvidia hot spots.

4770/4830 or 4870/4890 are ATI hot spots.
